page.title: 01GENERAL.
page.content: The East End of Greenock is divided almost equally between residential and industrial land-use, the industry is confined to the flat land of the raised beach along the Northern limit, as too are the main lines of communication, the A.8 road and the railway to Glasgow. Much of the heavy industry has declined. The shipyards now depend on oil rig construction. Most port facilities are unused, sugar being the only regular cargo. Housing is almost entirely local council rented by tenants. It consists of modernised old tenements, inter-war council built houses, post war high and low rise flats,& a few privately owned houses. The housing generally is south of the industry on the lower slopes of the Renfrew Heights. Though a low amenity area attempts are being made to improve the environment.
